title: Understanding JavaScript Closures
content: Closures are functions that retain access to their lexical scope, even when executed outside of it.

title: Getting Started with Express.js
content: Express.js is a minimal Node.js framework that simplifies routing and middleware management.

title: CSS Grid vs Flexbox: Which One to Use?
content: CSS Grid is best for 2D layouts, while Flexbox is great for 1D arrangements of elements.

title: The Power of Async/Await in JavaScript
content: Async/Await allows writing asynchronous code in a synchronous style, improving readability.

title: How to Optimize Website Performance
content: Optimizing images, reducing HTTP requests, and using caching can improve website speed significantly.
